image.altText: Large wind turbines stand in the ocean. No land is in sight, the wind turbines continue to the horizon.

props.synopsis: Any plans for turbines off the South Australian coast are gone, for now. But as the federal election looms, offshore wind will play a key role in Labor's renewable energy plan.

title.children: SA is a leader in renewable energy, but it said no to offshore wind

image.altText: An elderly man with a long beard and long white hair

props.synopsis: Peter Smith intervened in a fight at his unit in 2023 when he was set upon by his drinking buddy and bashed to death, a court has heard. His family say navigating his death has been a "nightmare".

title.children: Murder victim pleaded for life as he was bashed to death, court told

image.altText: Jing Lee in November 2022

props.synopsis: Jing Lee is the latest in a string of senior SA Liberal party members to announce their resignation, relinquishing her roles as shadow minister for tourism and multicultural affairs.

title.children: Senior SA Liberal announces resignation from party

image.altText: Close up of a mug with a magpie on its front and a tea bag hanging out

props.synopsis: Australia's hospitality industry is in need of training when it comes to serving up the world's most popular manufactured drink, tea experts say.

title.children: Tea drinkers face 'worst hospitality crime' in Aussie cafes

image.altText: A fire truck stationed next to the Wangary bushfire as it burns

props.synopsis: On January 11, 2005 a deadly fire near the tiny hamlet of Wangary on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula rewrote the record books in terms of fire spread and intensity, and prompted the state's fire warning system to be written.

title.children: Twenty years on, the Wangary bushfire still impacts SA's emergency response

image.altText: Drone image of surfers in water forming circle on boards at rocky beach

props.synopsis: A week after the search for his body concluded, surfers and members of the local community have paid tribute to Lance Appleby who was taken by a shark while surfing on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'He was an amazing human': Hundreds remember shark attack victim in touching paddle out event

image.altText: Egg shelves 1 (1)

props.synopsis: Eggs are in short supply on some major supermarket shelves months after the avian influenza outbreak, and farmers say it could be some time before supply is back to normal.

title.children: No quick fix for egg producers struggling to fill shortage

image.altText: A composite black and white image depicting baby Kobi Shepherdson and glasses-wearing Henry Shepherdson

props.synopsis: Henry Shepherdson inflicted months of coercive control on the mother of Kobi Shepherdson before killing the nine-month-old in a murder-suicide that shocked Australia. The harrowing police statements of Kobi's mother reveal the extent of his manipulation.

title.children: 'Please don't do this': Mother's plea before baby killed in murder-suicide

image.altText: Tennis player Stefanos Tsitsipas throws a towel over his shoulder at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Wildcards Ajla Tomljanović and Talia Gibson kick off day two of the Australian Open in style for the 12 locals in action, while Greek star Stefanos Tsitsipas falls in the first round for the second straight slam. Follow live.

title.children: Tsitsipas dumped out in first round as seeds start to fall at Australian Open

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: Two SA Police employees have been reported for unrelated corruption offences in just two days.

title.children: Two SAPOL employees facing unrelated corruption charges

image.altText: Sun setting over the Indian Ocean

props.synopsis: Temperatures in 2024 officially exceeded the Paris Agreement target. Does that mean the world has failed?

title.children: The world's breached 1.5 degrees. But wasn't that our climate target?

image.altText: A police van blocks entrance to a road.

props.synopsis: Four people are killed in a head-on crash involving a taxi and a station wagon, with police believing the driver who caused it intentionally drove on the wrong side of the road.

title.children: Driver made 'conscious' choice to drive wrong way down highway, killing four

image.altText: A firefighter climbs a steep slope as flames burn around him

props.synopsis: The US president-elect slams Californian officials over their handling the fires in LA.

title.children: Trump blasts LA officials as area bigger than San Francisco razed

image.altText: Arnold Frolows 2JJ T shirt

props.synopsis: One of the first people hired for the ABC's youth-focused radio station became one of Australian radio's most influential figures.

title.children: Arnold Frolows, who helped shape the sound of triple j for decades, dies

image.altText: A woman speaking and pointing

props.synopsis: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is one of just a handful of world leaders to have been invited to Mar-a-Lago since his election victory last November — but whether she can be Europe's "Trump whisperer" is more complicated.

title.children: World leaders are vying for Trump's ear, and this one has pulled ahead

image.altText: Uralla Luscombe-Pedro

props.synopsis: WA officials have defended the state's prescribed burning strategy after an enormous tingle tree was destroyed in a recent fire.

title.children: Giant 400-year-old tingle tree accidentally destroyed by authorities

image.altText: A race track damaged

props.synopsis: Police say they are keeping an open mind and it is too early to know if damage to a Gold Coast track ahead of Queensland's richest race day was deliberate.

title.children: Police identify poison used in Gold Coast Magic Millions track damage

image.altText: A pin k brick wall covered in advertisements and graffiti.

props.synopsis: A man charged over anti-Semitic graffiti on the wall of a pharmacy in Newcastle remains in custody after refusing to answer a magistrate's question in court.

title.children: Man accused of painting Nazi symbol on wall refuses to speak in court

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Malala Yousafzai speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Dozens of ministers and scholars from Muslim-majority countries attended the summit on girls' education in Pakistan.

title.children: Malala Yousafzai urges Muslim leaders to treat gender apartheid as a crime

image.altText: The sun rises behind a home destroyed by the Palisades Fire in the Pacific Palisades community of Los Angeles

props.synopsis: Investigations into what started the fires burning through homes and hectares of land in Los Angeles are still underway as firefighters brace for more extreme weather.

title.children: What to know about devastation from LA wildfires, crucial weather forecast

image.altText: A large industrial vessel pictured out at sea.

props.synopsis: Questions remain over the disappearance of 44-year-old Filipino deck fitter Gel Aguaviva, who went missing on board the RTM Zheng He on Boxing Day.

title.children: Crewmates 'very troubled' as worker still missing from Rio Tinto ship

image.altText: a white truck

props.synopsis: Queensland Police are seeking information about an abandoned vehicle they believe was used to leave the scene where a woman was shot in the back at Tallebudgera.

title.children: Police seek information as Gold Coast shooting victim wakes from coma

image.altText: A tall waterspout emerging from water

props.synopsis: Residents in northern WA have been treated to heavy rainfall, a peculiar sunset and a waterspout over the ocean — and there may be more on the way.

title.children: Mother Nature puts on a show in the Pilbara with strange skies and a massive waterspout

image.altText: Lightning over the hills with storms clouds and river and trees

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have been lashed by up to 100 millimetres of rain, with the Bureau of Meteorology predicting more wild weather could be on the way.

title.children: Queensland hit with heavy rains, with more wild weather on the way

image.altText: A yellow 'super scooper' firefighting plane dropping a dump of water over orange flames on a dark hill mound

props.synopsis: The FBI is searching for the owner of an unauthorised drone that crashed into a firefighting aircraft in Los Angeles last week.

title.children: FBI investigates drone that collided with aircraft fighting LA wildfires

image.altText: A man at a laptop

props.synopsis: An internet wholesaler says copper vandals are to blame for a string of lengthy dropouts lasting up to 36 hours, but residents argue providers should have backup to keep networks connected.

title.children: Internet operator 'on notice' over repeated lengthy outages in Cairns

image.altText: two people on a factory floor.

props.synopsis: Australia has a wealth of coal and gas resources as well as renewable energy, so why are energy costs so high — especially for manufacturers?

title.children: 'Obscenely expensive' wholesale gas prices driving manufacturing offshore

image.altText: Visitors alight from the ferry onto Rockingham's Penguin Island

props.synopsis: Conservationists are calling for Penguin Island to be closed to visitors to allow the dwindling little penguin population to recover — but the state government insists the decline is due to climate change, not tourism.

title.children: Calls for Penguin Island to shut amid wildlife loss

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market lost 1.2 per cent as banks were sold off while the Aussie dollar hit lows last seen in 2020. Here's how the day's trade unfolded, with insights from our business reporters, on the ABC News markets blog.

title.children: ASX loses more than 1pc as bank stocks tank — as it happened

image.altText: A yacht with a man on board in the water

props.synopsis: A WA sailor who has not been seen since leaving Albany more than a fortnight ago had done the journey solo many times, according to a friend.

title.children: Friends puzzled over disappearance of experienced yachtsman

image.altText: A police gazebo set up on a dry river bed next to a taped off crime scene.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have arrested a 49-year-old man after a woman was found dead near the Todd River in Alice Springs overnight.

title.children: Woman found dead near Alice Springs riverbed, male partner arrested

image.altText: Three people standing in a row wearing green shirts that read "Really social social club" on the back.

props.synopsis: Lily Grimley was grabbed by the throat during an altercation at a social netball game a few years ago, forcing her out of the competition that she joined purely for social reasons — and it's not uncommon.

title.children: 'Tried to grab at my throat': Competitiveness hurting social sport

image.altText: Frank painting

props.synopsis: More people than ever before are picking up multiple jobs as the high cost of living pushes Australians to take on extra work, but the tax office warns people not to get caught out and know their obligations.

title.children: 'Constantly chasing my tail': More Aussies get second job
